title: Mission Description
content: Inside the Herta Space Station, Herta's audience with Nous had yet to end. Using all the energy available in the station, Herta activates the Audience System's terminal to try to communicate with Nous. However, the system unexpectedly failed. Upon investigation, all three sectors within the terminal are malfunctioning, requiring Herta to personally attend to each one to resolve the issues.

line: Ah, an utterly ■■■ adventure! Feel free to replace ■■■ with whatever description you see fit!
I bet you're as curious as I am. So! What's going to happen next?
Heh, keep it together. All that excitement isn't going to get you anywhere, you know. Why don't you follow me into another tale on the other side of the cosmos...?
Ta-da! Recognize this place? Herta Space Station — the base of a genius and the cradle of science.
Look at these Herta puppets! Aren't they dearly exquisite? Let's just say I've already heard many others secretly gushing, "She looks so pretty" on more than one occasion...
If you ask me though, they barely did justice to Madam Herta's beauty! Maybe just 10%... no, not even 1% of the real deal! Now I'm no fawner here, just stating an objective fact...

Remember this scene? Gah, it evoked so much emotion in me! The esteemed Madam Herta, Genius Society #83, asking the great Nous a question! An attempt to gain a peek into the divinities' mysteries through THEM!
Alright, so continuing from where we left off last time, this is where everything would begin for the genius smart enough to rewrite the history of the entire cos—

speaker: Noble Female Voice
line: ...Tsk, Fourth Mirror. Who exactly are you talking to?

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Wh—Why, I was just ramping it up for our grand appearance, Madam Herta.

speaker: Herta
line: Hm. So, a dramatic debut...?

speaker: Herta
line: ...But what are the odds of that happening!? Sure, slightly plausible if I did manage to talk to Droidhead , but guess what's the problem...? THEY have no reaction whatsoever!

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Err... But look at this, Madam Herta... You're standing before Nous here! Right there.

speaker: Herta
line: Oh, that? That's a hologram. What? I can't possibly summon the real Droidhead here, can I?

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: ...You mean to say you've just been reciting your lines before a hologram!?

speaker: Herta
line: Yeah, creating dramatic value. Isn't that what you're most obsessed with?

speaker: Herta
line: Moving on. Don't try, but you wouldn't even begin to imagine how difficult it is to send a message to Nous. And I went all out for it...

speaker: Herta
line: Powering the Audience System alone required me to reconfigure the energy supply of the entire space station! I had to switch it to Hibernate mode before rebooting everything. Do you have any idea how much that costs?

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: ...How much? How much?

speaker: Herta
line: Uh...

speaker: Herta
line: ...I'm not in charge of finance. Go pose that to Asta instead.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: So you don't know either!

speaker: Herta
line: I am Herta herself, the Emanator of Erudition and a true-blue genius. Why would I be holding the purse strings? That menial task is beneath me.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: You're absolutely right, Madam Herta! The IPC should really be providing a genius like you with all that you require, so you can freely dive into any research that tickles your fancy!

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: With that said, Herta herself, Emanator of Erudition, and true-blue genius... What do you plan to do now?

speaker: Herta
line: What else can I do? Identify what's malfunctioning within the Audience System and fix it, of course.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Um... Don't take offense to my candid words, Madam Herta. You may be proficient in many aspects, but... is hands-on work really one of your strong suits?

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Um... I humbly suggest for you to contact Stephen instead...

speaker: Herta
line: Contact him and expose how I shelled out a bomb to send a message to Droidhead, only to screw up everything else?

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Mm, alright, alright. I get it...

speaker: Herta
line: Good that you do.

speaker: Herta
line: There. That's the Audience System's terminal. Come, walk with me. We'll check what's wrong with it.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Aye-aye, ma'am! Oh, but I can't walk. I can only float...

speaker: Herta
line: What's with your witty remarks today?

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Hmm... This is the Audience System? It looks just like the Simulated Universe .

speaker: Herta
line: Keen observation. They share the same fundamental logic, and are pretty much identical in that regard.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Ahh, I see. We call this... referencing, and not appropriation, right? Heh...

speaker: Herta
line: One more stupid remark from you and you can watch Fifth Mirror reference your role, because I'm going to be dropping you as my assistant.

speaker: Herta
line: Focus now. The Audience System is divided into three zones: Energy Supply, Computing, and Communications. Each zone operates independently, and will only be integrated via the Path of Erudition when the system is booted.

speaker: Herta
line: Sending a message to Droidhead involves more intricacies than you can imagine. If routine trials and maintenance on such an elaborately sophisticated system are already as bad as squaring circles, then it's no surprise for glitches like this to crop up.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: I see. So, Madam Herta, can you use your professional judgment to tell which zone the glitch is in?

speaker: Herta
line: Of course. All three.

speaker: Herta
line: No sweat. They'll be up and running again after some simple technical tweaking.

speaker: Herta
line: The three zones are compartmentalized, so we're going to have to troubleshoot them one at a time. Let's start with the Energy Supply Zone. Get ready, and then we'll go over.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: I'm just a mirror, Madam Herta! If you're ready, then your reflection in me will also be ready to go.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Brr... Why is this Energy Supply Zone... so cold? Brr... I—I'm already frosting up!

speaker: Herta
line: Hmph, why else? I've converted the energy core that supplies all of Herta Space Station into Imaginary state and stored it in this zone. If not for the ultra-low temperature here, the space station would have long blasted off into the sky.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Brrr... But... aren't we already... in the sky?

speaker: Herta
line: ...You're just a mirror. I don't need you to take on comic relief too.

speaker: Herta
line: Where did those things come from? Corrupted data? Reanimated systemic rust? No, not likely... It can't be the Legion's second ambush, right...?

speaker: Herta
line: Meh, whatever. We have to get rid of them anyway. Alright, stay close and try to avoid shattering to pieces!

text: Clear the abnormalities in the Energy Supply Zone

title: Step Description
content: Inside the Herta Space Station, Herta's audience with Nous had yet to end. Using all the energy available in the station, Herta activates the Audience System's terminal to try to communicate with Nous. However, the system unexpectedly failed. Upon investigation, all three sectors within the terminal are malfunctioning, requiring Herta to personally attend to each one to resolve the issues.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: What's this, ma'am?

speaker: Herta
line: Mm, looks like one of those Memory Bubbles. It's not worth that much attention. You'll find many more in the other zones.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Hmm... is that so.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Brrr... Aaaaand Madam Herta never fails to impress! Those things are no match for you!

speaker: Herta
line: Hmph, a piece of cake!

speaker: Herta
line: Now that this place is cleaned up, let's set everything in order and move on to the next zone.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Wh—What in the...!? How did all these disgusting bugs get in here?

speaker: Herta
line: We're going to need out-of-this-world computing capability if we hope to meet Droidhead. If we can't churn out calculations faster than a yottaFLOPS computer, then we can forget about having THEM notice our existence.

speaker: Herta
line: But computers with too high a computing capability tend to attract Computing Stings like them. No one knows how these creatures evolved from their progenitor — the Propagation.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Ah, the mysteries of life. Hah! But even so, they can't compare to a talking mirror~

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: A question on the side, Madam Herta: You have these powerful supercomputers and all, so... um, what are they normally programmed to calculate?

speaker: Herta
line: Is that important? All that matters is that they work and are able to attract Droidhead's attention.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: *sigh* ...I suggest meeting Miss Asta for a chat when you have time.

text: Clear the abnormalities in the Computing Zone

title: Step Description
content: Inside the Herta Space Station, Herta's audience with Nous had yet to end. Using all the energy available in the station, Herta activates the Audience System's terminal to try to communicate with Nous. However, the system unexpectedly failed. Upon investigation, all three sectors within the terminal are malfunctioning, requiring Herta to personally attend to each one to resolve the issues.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: There's a Memory Bubble here too...

speaker: Herta
line: Why are you so interested in it?

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Okay, I'll admit it. I find them somewhat... creepy?

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Ew, yuck! Help me! Goo from those bugs got onto my reflective surface!

speaker: Herta
line: Clean up after yourself. Can't you just wipe it off with your hands?

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: ...Ahaha! Good one there...

speaker: Herta
line: With those annoying bugs squashed, we're done fixing the Computing Zone too.

speaker: Herta
line: These computers will get up to speed soon. Now we're just one final step away from requesting an audience with Droidhead.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Our last stop is the... Communications Zone?

speaker: Herta
line: Oh? You have a good memory. Let's go see what's wrong in that zone.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Wh—What's all this? I didn't think your puppets would be in here too, Madam Herta.

speaker: Herta
line: Unsurprisingly, the Communications Zone is where a bridge for communication will be formed between Droidhead and the space station.

speaker: Herta
line: Aggregating the Path Energy of the Erudition, then firing a "bond" at the Aeon . This is as good as tapping someone on the shoulder, who's sure to turn back to look at you.

speaker: Herta
line: Alas, our work is never this simple. Putting aside all that onerous legwork, a single glance from Droidhead... could vaporize the entire space station if we're ill-prepared.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: I see... So letting the space station go into hibernation is a protective measure of sorts? To prevent it from slipping into operational overload and turning into a scrap world?

speaker: Herta
line: Hm, very perceptive for a mirror.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Mirror see (and hear), mirror do! Though I neither have eyes nor ears, haha!

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: This zone... seems to be functioning fine? These puppets are doing their job, and I don't see any obvious malfunction...

speaker: Herta
line: Things may look fine only on the surface.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Madam Herta, behind you—

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: ...Hm? What does she want?

speaker: Herta
line: Let me take a look. This puppet... should be #2757.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: H—How did you tell!?

speaker: Herta
line: Shh! Don't distract me when I'm checking the puppet's parameters. #2757...

speaker: Herta
line: Hmm... That's strange...

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Er... What's wrong, Madam Herta?

speaker: Herta
line: The "Replica Personality Module"... is off. That can't be. This parameter is set to be enabled by default.

speaker: Herta
line: And the "Utterly Absurd Module"... has also been disabled? Something's definitely wrong here. I checked a couple days ago to make sure every puppet has it switched on...

speaker: Herta
line: The "Attack Anything Everything Module"...

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: No, wait. Why do you even have such presets!?

speaker: Herta
line: ...is enabled.

speaker: Herta Puppet
line: Intruder. Detected.

speaker: Herta
line: Drats. Come and help me, mirror...

speaker: Herta Puppet
line: Anything, everything. Attack!

text: (Begin battle againstMemory Zone Meme "Heartbreaker"×3,Memory Zone Meme "Allseer"×2)

speaker: Herta
line: These are... memetic remnants of the Remembrance ?

speaker: Herta
line: So they were the ones that corrupted and tampered with the settings of my puppets?

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Egad, what a close shave... But why are these Remembrance memes even showing up here?

speaker: Herta
line: That's not the only one. Look at them. #7631 and #10136... are affected too.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Can't you do a remote factory reset on them?

speaker: Herta
line: Sorry to disappoint. The "Absolutely Not Module" has been enabled, so not even I get to bypass its permissions. Whoopsie.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: ...What were you really trying to achieve with these creations?

speaker: Herta
line: Just some toys to amuse myself with.

speaker: Herta
line: Finding the source of the corruption can wait. These puppets no longer have use now that I'm here. Take them all out! Defective goods ought to be sent back to the repair center!

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: I... urge you to go easy on them, for the sake of the space station...

title: Step Description
content: Inside the Herta Space Station, Herta's audience with Nous had yet to end. Using all the energy available in the station, Herta activates the Audience System's terminal to try to communicate with Nous. However, the system unexpectedly failed. Upon investigation, all three sectors within the terminal are malfunctioning, requiring Herta to personally attend to each one to resolve the issues.

text: Head deeper to investigate the puppet's signal

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: They're completely battered, save for... their heads?

speaker: Herta
line: Never strike someone in the face — the same goes for puppets.

speaker: Herta
line: I'm picking up signals from more puppets somewhere farther in. Let's go take a look.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: A Memory Bubble tucked away this far in?

speaker: Herta
line: Heh... I think I know what this is about now. This is interesting.

speaker: Herta
line: But we can leave that for later... Let's take care of the malfunctioning puppets first.

speaker: Herta
line: Ah, #0988. The pride of my creations!

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: ...Should I even be curious...?

speaker: Herta
line: Puppets before her were all as dull as brick walls, mundane and uninspired. I distinctly recall #0988 being the first puppet I imbued with... a magical surprise. Some other puppets that came later also got to enjoy similar privileges.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: ...Good to know, but did anyone ask!?

speaker: Herta
line: Fear not, mirror. You have to remember that being a genius means you're destined to solve challenge after challenge. There's no time for rest.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: ...C—Can I just be on the sidelines this time? Pretty please!?

text: (Begin battle againstHerta #ErrorModel, which transforms intoSwarm: True Sting)

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Phew, that was close... I almost shattered...

speaker: Herta
line: Don't be melodramatic. Working even a single brain cell of mine to take out foes like her is an outright waste of my smarts.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: I take it we've taken care of the problems in all three zones? Does that mean...?

speaker: Herta
line: Not yet. There's something else we need to deal with.

speaker: Herta
line: It seems we've had a little tagalong all this while...

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: You've got quite the sharp eye, Madam Herta. Would you like us to help?

speaker: Herta
line: Sure, go ahead and summon the whole team, Fourth Mirror.

speaker: Herta
line: Considering the gravity of our endeavor, we can't allow a little thief to spoil the show.

speaker: Herta
line: Hmph, parasite of the Remembrance. Do you truly think your atrocious disguise can outwit the keen sight of a genius like myself?

speaker: Herta
line: Once you're reflected in my mirrors...

speaker: Herta
line: ...you can forget about escaping.

speaker: Memosnatcher
line: Oh dear, oh dear. This is bad...

speaker: Memosnatcher
line: Right, stay alive and again I can strive... Retreat into the Memory Zone for now, I can always regroup and try again!

speaker: Herta
line: Someone hasn't been paying attention.

speaker: Herta
line: Didn't hear me, did you? With those petty tricks of yours... do you actually think you can slip away right under my nose?

speaker: Memosnatcher
line: Herta... Madam Herta, wait! Wh—What do you want with me...?

speaker: Memosnatcher
line: I... I'll spill it all! The Garden 's secrets and what they're after... everything! P—Please just spare me...

speaker: Herta
line: Well, is that all you've got to say while your life is at stake? That's hardly worth anything.

speaker: Herta
line: Need a little refresher? I am Herta, Genius Society #83, the one to unravel the mystery behind the imaginary leakage phenomenon, and keyholder of the Imaginary Implosion Pulse... Do you honestly believe I'd seek any counsel from you?

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission A Witch's Scientific Repose.mp4

speaker: Herta
line: Hush now, keep quiet. This is my moment to shine, so just listen.

speaker: Herta
line: You crept in here to steal Nous' memories , didn't you?

speaker: Herta
line: And messing with my precious Audience System is just a ruse to lure me here so I can lead you to THEM...

speaker: Herta
line: What a shame. You're only a step away from completing the mission assigned to you...

speaker: Memosnatcher
line: Mmph...! Nngh...!

speaker: Herta
line: ...As if. Truth is, you never stood a chance from the get-go, teehee!

speaker: Herta
line: Think I only have Fourth Mirror following me around? Then you've let your guard down, because her siblings have long been watching your every move. Now, let me think... What kind of punishment should I subject a brazen thief like you to?

speaker: Herta
line: Ooh, I know! You Garden folk have a fondness for mirrors, huh... How about letting you enjoy some quality time with your favorite object — a mirror?

speaker: Herta
line: As for the length of your punishment... Let's keep it mildly punitive. How about a hundredth of a lifetime? That should be enough for some serious self-reflection.

speaker: Herta
line: Aww, cheer up. You can still do your part for this world while trapped in a mirror. For all you know, your weak Path Energy could just help me get Droidhead looking this way.

speaker: Herta
line: Ah, I should make myself clear. When I said a hundredth of a lifetime ...

speaker: Herta
line: ...I meant my lifetime.

speaker: Herta
line: Ahh, at long last... We can finally be at ease now that we've nipped those problems in the bud.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Omnomnom... Mmm, this is yummy...

speaker: Herta
line: Cut that out! Those weird noises make me seem like I've got a few screws loose. Put that little thief to sleep for now. We can decide her fate later.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Oh, sweet and venerable Madam Herta, when did your heart turn this tender?

speaker: Herta
line: The Audience System has been rebooted. This is finally it...

speaker: Herta
line: After all that I've done to reach you, Droidhead... You'd better not snub me.

text: Interact with the terminal and try to speak with Nous

title: Step Description
content: The root cause of the malfunction is an invasion of Memosnatchers. After uprooting the problem, Herta is about to formally enter the Path Space to seek an audience with Nous.

speaker: Herta
line: (The Path Space... This isn't a figment of the Simulated Universe, but a perfectly tangible and accessible space...)

speaker: Herta
line: (Right. Now's not the time to wallow in nostalgia. Droidhead... Will you answer me?)

text: Approach the First Mirror to advance the audience's progress

title: Step Description
content: The audience appears to be proceeding smoothly, but... the voice from beyond the sky that Herta hears doesn't seem quite right.

speaker: First Mirror
line: Madam Herta... We picked up some voices from the space.

speaker: Herta
line: Hmm? Let me hear them.

speaker: Herta
line: Is this... binary arithmetic? Could it be Droidhead?

speaker: Herta
line: Wait, there shouldn't be a "2" in binary arithmetic!

speaker: Herta
line: Is this some kind of prank...?

text: Approach the Second Mirror to advance the audience's progress

speaker: Second Mirror
line: Madam Herta! We're hearing those voices again!

speaker: Second Mirror
line: What now? What should we do!?

speaker: Herta
line: Keep your cool, Second Mirror. What did they say this time? Play it again for me.

speaker: Voice of Path 2
line: Wait a minute. This door... isn't locked?

speaker: Herta
line: Door...? Locked...?

speaker: Herta
line: No, this isn't the Voice of the Path at all...! What in the world is going on?

text: Approach the Third Mirror to advance the audience's progress

speaker: Third Mirror
line: Hyuk hyuk hyuk... Madam Herta, those lads outside... seem to be discussing something interesting...

speaker: Third Mirror
line: Wanna listen in on them? Hyuk hyuk hyuk...

speaker: Herta
line: Third Mirror! Stop that nightmarish cackle. It's giving me goosebumps.

speaker: Herta
line: Wait, did you say "those lads outside"? Could it be...

speaker: Third Mirror
line: Eheheh... Why don't you listen for yourself?

speaker: Voice of Path 1
line: She fainted?

speaker: Voice of Path 2
line: Mm-hmm, looks like it.

speaker: Herta
line: ...This isn't right. I'm sure we've got intruders in the lab!

speaker: Voice of Path 2
line: Should we rouse her, Mr. Yang ?

speaker: Voice of Path 1
line: ...Let's do it. I'm not sure she'll be happy about it, but we have no time to waste.

speaker: Herta
line: ...Wait! S—Stop whatever you're about to do...

speaker: Herta
line: No, don't even think about it! Whoever you are, you'd better not interrupt me right now!

speaker: Herta
line: I must continue forward... Just a few more steps and I'll be able to see Droidhead!

text: Approach the Fourth Mirror to advance the audience's progress

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Is something wrong, Madam Herta?

speaker: Herta
line: No, it's nothing. I was just thinking...

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Um, Madam Herta... I think you'll want to listen to the voices from beyond this space...

speaker: Voice of Path 1
line: I'll leave it to you then, Mr. Sunday .

speaker: Voice of Path 2
line: My pleasure.

speaker: Herta
line: Wait... What are they up to?

speaker: Voice of Path 2
line: Please pardon me, Madam Herta—

speaker: Herta
line: Is this... the Harmony ?

speaker: Herta
line: Ridiculous! Hoping to stop me with such cheap parlor tricks? Not a chance!

speaker: Voice of Path 2
line: She easily dispelled the Resonance with her subconscious mind... as expected of an Emanator.

speaker: Voice of Path 1
line: Is there something else we can try?

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Bahaha! Presumptuous fellows. Who are you to interrupt Madam Herta's experiment?

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Let's ignore them and keep going. We haven't seen Nous yet!

speaker: Herta
line: ...Forget it, mirror. Let's just leave.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: Leave? S—Surely you're not suggesting... we stop the Audience Experiment right now?

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: That's beyond all reason, ma'am! We went through so much just to get here! Now we're just one step away from making contact with the Aeon THEMSELF... Please, you know how insanely costly it is to reboot the Audience System!

speaker: Herta
line: But if I were to ignore those two intruders and continue onward... When Droidhead casts THEIR gaze upon the space station, the blast of energy generated in that instant is sure to burn them to a crisp.

speaker: Herta
line: Experiments can always be repeated, but humans cannot be brought back to life.

speaker: Fourth Mirror
line: *sob* Oh Madam Herta, so selfless and kind! I'm a truly lucky mirror to have found the best possible master...

speaker: Herta
line: Enough. Don't use that nauseatingly fawning tone on me!

speaker: Herta
line: ...Looks like I'll have to abort this prematurely again.

speaker: Herta
line: But mark my words, Droidhead: I will be back for you...

speaker: Welt
line: ...Madam Herta? You're finally awake.

speaker: Herta
line: ...You two...

speaker: Herta
line: My plan is ruined! And it's all thanks to you!

speaker: Sunday
line: ...Your plan?

speaker: Welt
line: My sincerest apologies, Madam Herta... We weren't aware this was a part of your plan.

speaker: Welt
line: The space station was in complete darkness when we arrived, so Sunday and I assumed something bad had happened. We continued further into the space station, hoping to find the cause of the blackout... and that's when we chanced upon your... actual self.

speaker: Herta
line: How did you get in?

speaker: Sunday
line: The door wasn't locked.

speaker: Herta
line: Alright, fine... I am a person of reason, after all. You're not to blame for this.

speaker: Herta
line: I am familiar with Mr. Yang of the Astral Express , but the one next to you...

speaker: Welt
line: ...Looks like Madam Herta doesn't pay much attention to cosmic news.

speaker: Sunday
line: Please pardon my manners. It is unbecoming of me to forget the most basic of courtesies amid all that has happened... My name's Sunday, and I'm just a passenger of the Express.

speaker: Herta
line: And this unremarkable passenger... happens to be a Harmony Pathstrider? Hmph, do you take me for a child?

speaker: Herta
line: In any case, I don't suppose you came all the way here just to check on how the space station is doing?

speaker: Welt
line: Well, we were worried for a moment there... but it's good to know the space station isn't in any kind of trouble.

speaker: Welt
line: We're here because of Amphoreus , Madam Herta.

speaker: Herta
line: Hm. Why does that not surprise me?

speaker: Welt
line: Oh? Something occured to you?

speaker: Herta
line: No, I've told Himeko everything I know. Nothing about the world sounds right. Droidhead has cast THEIR gaze upon numerous worlds in the past... and every one of them is etched in my mind. So how could I possibly not know about it?

speaker: Herta
line: Perhaps those Garden folks lied to you. Anyhow, I've looked up the name Amphoreus in the Simulated Universe. Though clearly irrelevant results have already been filtered out...

speaker: Herta
line: There's still an unbelievably long list of generated results. Something about how the Divine Amphoreus team will swap out their current crest emblem for one in King Baviru's likeness in the next season. I hope that can be of some help to you.

speaker: Welt
line: ...We may as well take a look at it.

speaker: Herta
line: I still don't get it, though. Didn't the Astral Express already depart some time ago? Is that world so incredibly spectacular that it warrants this return trip?

speaker: Welt
line: Well, that's because... we're caught between a rock and a hard place.

speaker: Welt
line: If Amphoreus is indeed inextricably entwined with Aeons, Paths, and even the Erudition, we're going to need the wisdom of a genius to help us. Especially now that we've seen the planet for ourselves.

speaker: Herta
line: Elaborate a little on this "rock and a hard place" you're caught between?

speaker: Welt
line: We've lost all contact with two indispensable companions since they entered Amphoreus.

speaker: Welt
line: And that's not all... One of our other companions is suffering from a serious and inexplicable affliction.

text: When you have a chance to make a choice, make one that you know you won't regret.
